column2: Size6not@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm taking this to help with my asthma. The great side effect for me is the weight loss. I started this brand on Thursday Here it is Saturday morning lost 5.4 lbs. and I can breath fine in this humid weather. I don't have all the bad side effect because I'm use to caffeine (Cola soda/coffee black). That the problem for most people They're not use to the feeling(like drinking Red Bull). If you eat a good diet and walk around ,you should get The result you want. Then again if this is your last resort for dieting maybe it's you. Just maybe.

column2: golfer, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for about 6 weeks along with a protein diet and exercise.  I have only lost 5 lbs and now I have an extreme sensitivity to sunlight (outbreak of severe hives covering 60% of my body.

column2: greatful, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: this medicine has realy helped alot i have tried many over the counter diet pills with no results

column2: overweight, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking tenuate several years ago under a doctors supervison. I lost 75 lbs the first year.  Once I stopped taking the pills I gained even more weight , developed colitis, high blood pressure, vision problems ,and excessive weight gain .  I stayed off the med for aprox 2 yrs. Frustrated with the 100 lbs I had gained back I began taking tenuate once again.  However this timeI broke out in hives all over my body , my throat was swollen and itchy .  I went to an emergency clinic I was having severe allergic reaction to the tenuate. Currently I am still 100lbs over weight and have several medical conditions all from this diet pill .   I have tried countless efforts to loose the weight but have been unsucessful.  I do not recommend this diet pill to anyone .

column2: Betty, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
kamyo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this in conjuction with prescription phentermine. So far, not impressed. I have lost only 2 lbs in 4 weeks since starting this (I was taking only then phentermine for 2 weeks before that) Im pretty disappointed. My doc suggested I try it. But so far.... she says to give it some time. I am looking to lose about 20 more lbs. I see that so many people posting on here are so excited about losing unhealthy amounts of weight quickly. It didnt take 2 weeks to get heavy, so if you lose it fast, you will gain it back even faster. I do exercise, but not as much as I would prefer due to my schedule. I will give it another couple of weeks.

column2: misty, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i borrowed a week's worth of this med from a friend that just quit taking it cuz she reached her desired weight.. well i took the 3 times a day dosage of 25mg.. and its wonderful. i have lost 11 lbs in this one week. i am going to doc to get on it officially. i did have a mild headache alot of the time.. but is worth it to me to shed this much weight in this time period..

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I do not even know where to begin with this medication.  I have headaches everyday, feel slightly depressed (which I have never felt in my life) and have not seen any positive results for the past two weeks I have been taking it.  If anything my hunger has increased and my desire for exercise as almost totally went away.  I have heard so many positive things about this medication, but for me it has been a terrible experience!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am not quite sure how to rate this pill. I have literally taken only one 25mg pill today, and 30-40 min later I became exremely nauseaus for about 45 min. I see so many great reviews, and really do want to try it. I am not sure if the nausea was just a coinsidence, or if it's a side effect. Anyone have any similar reactions?

column2: qwerty68, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this drug for four days, once a day midmorning to late lunch time.  The dizziness and nausea were nonstop and began within a few hours of my taking the pill.  The headaches I experienced were not lessened by any OTC headache pill.  I did not experience any other symptoms beyond nausea, dizziness and headaches -- which were plenty!  I tried taking half a pill on the fifth day....although the syptoms were less severe than the other four days, they were still strong enough to prevent me from going about my day as normal.  I stopped taking the pill after the fifth day.

column2: lizwolf, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have a BMI over 38. While this drug stopped my interest in eating, I spent a whole day with heart flutters, out of breath, dizziness when standing up and walking, and other odd sensations. The dull headache throughout did not improve my experience. Off and on my throat would feel tight and if I was wearing a scarf that was tied too tight.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used this drug for the past week. I was started on a low dose(1/2 a 25 mg pill 2 times a day). I can honestly say that I feel great. I can focus on my daily tasks, I am not hungry or anxious. I feel energized. I workout for an hour and feel great!I am having a little trouble falling asleep so I take my last dose at 3pm. I have lost 6 lbs in 4 days.

column2: ht, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: i have lost 9lbs in the first week or taking this med. i want to lose about 15 more it shouldnt b that long being as im shedding over a lb a day

column2: dawnstar, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Has anyone noticed anything when you drink coffee in the morning, with this medication?I get a little irratable, but hunger is not a problem. Perhaps I should eat a small breakfast also. This is the meal I skip usually. It does reduce appetite, making it easier to make wise choices.

column2: JudyBoh, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I too just started taking this medication.  Thing is the same week I started taking it, my throat decided to slightly swell up and have a horrible sore throat with inflamed lymph nodes.  Just a coincidence or a side effect??  Thanks.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
TinyTushy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took this drug one year ago and lost 35 pounds. I stopped taking it and lost 5 pounds on my own since it shrunk my stomach. I have maintained my weight since but would like to get the last 10 off. I have start the pill again while working out between 30 and 40 minutes a day. After only 2 days back on my stomach is FLAT as a board. Love this pill. No heart trouble. Minor insomnia but that goes away. The first day is the work with the killer migraine, but the end result is worth it. Plus it shrinks your stomach so it is not a lifetime pill. make sure you learn how to eat right and not use it as a free-for-free. work with the pill and this will be the end of your weigh loss woes :)

column2: Delores, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I eat in response to stress.  This has caused me to feel stressful. My doctor recommended that I cut the pill in half and take it twice a day.  I have gained weight and developed TMJ.

column2: Mom Of 4, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am just starting this medication and have read many of the reviews. I did take phentermine for quite some time and the results were amazing but the heart palpations were terrible. No matter how early I took it, I was still wide awake at night. My doctor said that diethylpropion is more cardio friendly than phentermine. I am starting on the 25 mg tablets 3 times a day so I can judge if they will keep me awake...and also if I experience the heart palpations. I plan on easing myself into this. The phentermine just made me stop eating. I only ate once a day - no exercise. Of course, as soon as I stopped taking them the weight slowly crept back on. I would like to be more careful with these diet pills and make a habit of eating better so when I do stop, I can keep it off. Good luck everyone!!!

column2: amanda0908, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: WOW!! been on this pill for 3 months, lost 30, lost 5 more on my own!! Shrunk my stomach from no eating and no jitters. went from 165 to 133!!! MIRACLE PILL!

column2: dalilah, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this is great. i have been taking it everyday once a day and i dont even get hungry anymore even when i make it for the rest of the family. and being mexican we fry alot of good food. i only take a 25mg so i dont know what the other mg are like. but i have lost weight i am now at 149 from the 165 that i was at. but i work out 5 days a week. but the weight before, would just not come off no matter how much less i was eating and how many times a week i worked out. i feel great. no side effects( that are bad) i have more energy and im not hungry. i have to make myself eat or else i just wont feel hungry.

column2: dingo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was previously on phentermine and saw little results so Dr changed to this.  When I saw all the posts I was very excited, but so far have not seen much of a change in about 6 weeks.  Dont get your hopes up, cuz it is hard to bounce back if it doesnt work.  I have been working out at least three times a week and monitoring what I eat.  I go back to the Dr in a week I will have to wait and see what she says.  I wish it would have been as easy for me as other people made it out to be.

column2: mom34, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Second day on this med. and i am not hungry, or even thinking about food. I take one 75 mg at 7:00am and i make myself eat a slice of rasin bread around 10am. i do have a mild headache all day, took bc powder early this morning before headache came, and havnet had one yet. I want to lose 10 pounds, and am very excited i dont have the muchies at all! Will let you know how its gong in a few more day, with an update on what i have lost.

column2: Shelly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: skinnyminny, 19-24 Female  (Patient)

column2: Nothing good, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While I haven't experienced any side effects using this drugs, I have found it pretty ineffective at controlling appetite so far.  I've been taking it for a week and still find myself hungry most days.  I have taken phentermine in the past and found it much more effective.  My doctor gave me this drug because I have borderline blood pressure.

column2: WT, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for almost 3 months and, during my dr visit this morning, I just found out that I've lost 31 pounds!  The first few days were an adjustment period.  I felt a little light-headed and hyper for 3 or 4 days.  After that, I felt fine.  Cravings were curbed as were the late afternoon, early evening munchies.  I took 75 mg once a day.  I had to experiment with the time a little.  If I took it too early in the morning, it didn't work as well for me.  I take it at about 10:30 every morning now.  I"ve very happy that my doctor suggested this medication.

column2: mom27, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: dry mouth

column2: supermom072003, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Deedle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been using for 1 week.  I previously had gastric bypass in 2003 but slowly gained back some of the weight due to over eating and pregnancy.  I find that just in the first week of using this drug that my hunger has curbed signifigantly and my enery has also increased.  I take 25MG 1/2 before each meal 3 times a day.  I have also noticed that I am more thirsty so my water consumption has increased.  No other side effects thus far.  Haven't been on the scale yet to see if there has been weight loss, but am looking forward to it at my next doctor's visit.

column2: Fab at 40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for 2 weeks and have lost 12 lbs with no excercise.  I do plan to walk on my treadmill going forward, but what a boost after only 2 weeks!  My doc also has be taking a diuretic and b12 shots since is a a drug that works on the CNS.  I highly suggest the diuretic which reduces the increased blood pressure this pill causes.

column2: noelle64, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i started this drug with hopes of helping me lose weight and I have been on it for 2 weeks, eating 3 meals a day, but watching calorie intake and I have already lost 20lbs. The best thing out there and I have tried everything short of gastric bypass.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Only took 25 mg in the morning for a couple of days and got intense heart palpitations and my blood pressure skyrocketed.  Any one else get these side affects?  Thank you.

column2: staraso, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on the 75mg/day pill for 3 weeks now and have lost 20lbs w/o exercise. No side effects I can complain about, except keeping me up until 2am almost daily. What this drug does is get rid of your munchies. I normally eat less then 1000 calories a day now and I feel great! I have more energy too! It feels like this is how you should have always felt about food but couldn't do by your self. If anything its a motivation tool for me. I can honestly say I would never go back to eating the way I did.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After taking this med for only 4 weeks I have lost 17 pounds!!!! I don't really do any exercising. I just mainly take the pill and count calories. I go back to the doctor in another 4 weeks and hopefully by then my weight goal will be met!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I lost 14 lbs in two months. With patience, this drug does work. It REALLY does stop a lot of food cravings and, as one other reviewer stated, it makes you forget about food. You can eat what you want, but I noticed that, even when it was something I thought I wanted, I ate very little and pushed it away. With faithful dieting and exercising, this drug would be very effective. I have been off the drug for about 4 months now. The cravings are back, and so is the weight (and then some).

column2: larson382003, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on it for a week, but it stop ALL of the nibbling. I`m not jitter. I`m not going to step on the scale till I go to the doctor. But I feel good. now just waiting for the  pounds to fall off., I am walking and biking to boot!! good luck all!

column2: pj, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Lost 27 pounds in 2months along with good excercise.

column2: Neeve, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I have 40 pounds to lose and I know I'll get it off within 4 months! I'm so excited!

column2: minnieme , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The hard part was fasting for 2 consecutive days when first starting the plan.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: gee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for 4 days now and can already feel a difference in my pants.  I started this at 182 I wieghed in this morning at 179...so far, 3 pounds in 4 days.  I don't have any bad side effects - I do notice that I talk an awful lot though, i have way more energy this week than last too.  I feel a little dry mouth now and then but nothing a little gum won't fix. I eat oatmeal and toast with peanut butter for breakfast and a lite salad for lunch. I haven't eaten dinner lately because I'm not hungry.  I am very confindent that this is going to work wonders!

column2: CeliaH85, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication in September of 2006.  In addition, I did easy workouts when I could (which honestly was hardly ever) and added a liquid Vitamin B supplement to my diet twice a day.  Within a matter about 6 months, I had lost about 50 pounds.  I had dropped several pant sizes, down to a 7 or 8 from an eleven or higher.  Shirts went from extra large to large, and then to a medium.  I have kept all of that weight off for over 2 years, as it is now February of 2008.If you are having problems losing a large aount of weight, I strongly advise you to talk with your doctor about this medication.  What I was using was Diethylpropion 75mg extended release.  The only side effects I noticed was light headedness, especially when I was smoking.

column2: jorie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The medication works great to suppress appitite. I'm on the 23 mg twice a day. The only problem I have is sleeping.

column2: Michelle, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on it for a three weeks and have gone from 225-217 in about 2-3 weeks which is healthy weight loss. I wasn't looking for it to make the weight go rapidly but to curb the snacking. Remember the quicker the weight goes off the quicker it will come back on when you get off of the pill. While taking the pill, I keep a food journal and keep my calories to 1,000 a day and sometimes under. I also walk everyday. It's about lifestyle changes and not losing weight quickly. Because what goes up must come down. I'm learning how to eat better and to make better choices with food and to get into the habit of exercising everyday. i even give myself cheat days so I'm not depriving myself and then go on a binge and gain the weight right back. Be Smart! I have gotten headaches too but I thought that it was from not eating. So I get a snack and take a tylenol. And I also drink plenty of water. I noticed that the days I didn't drink water that the weight loss came to a standstill.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this pill 75mg two weeks now. I only lost 7 1/2 pounds,  and i do have side effects. I have the fast irregular heatbeats at brief moments and chest pain all day except when I am eating. The pain started after the 1st week.

column2: kduncan618, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a wonderful pill I started on the pill around the 2nd week of December so far I have lost 10 pounds and 5 inches from my waist I did find that I had a dry mouth but I drank plenty of water I also get real bad headaches from taking the pills this is something that I knew would probably  a curry when taking this medication over all this is great I have started my video diet I will be posting it on the web soon so look for me the before and after

column2: Twinkle, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this drug controlled my late night snacking habits and overeating. Ilean to eat in portions because I wasn't hungry that much or didn't want alot to eat

column9: This has worked somewhat but I may have to stop taking it as I have awful headaches. Anyone else experience this side affect? I haven't taken it for 3 days now. When I do take it at 9am I will have a headache by 10. Very dull headache. But not hardly hurt the pain to be thin.

column2: MIKAS, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: today is only day 2 but i have noticed i am less hungry.. i am on phentermine in the am and this one at 12pm. since i start my @ 3:30am i needed an aftrenoon boost... i am concerned about the sexual side effects.. anyone have this problem???

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: So far I have lost about 38 pounds.  I don't exercise and I still whatever I want - pizza and donuts.  You only get hungry when your body needs calories and you don't feel the need to gorge.  On a side note - I used to have severe depression and anxiety. I have felt completely normal and calm since I have been taking the medication.  I have not had one panic attack and I don't have crazy mood-swings anymore.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug has really worked well for me.  I lost 20 pounds in two months.  During this time, I was able to feel good about a new exercise plan and changes in my diet.  I feel like a new person.  I had absolutely no side affects.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication about 6 months ago to lose weight. I have been very successful, losing about 30 pounds so far, without having to do very much excercise (although when you excercise it speeds up the weight loss). After 4 or 5 months I started to plateau and needed to step up my work outs to continue to see results.However, I would caution anyone with an anxiety/mood disorder when considering this medication, such as I have. For the first few weeks I had trouble falling asleep and needed to take a sedative. Once I got used to the medication, I started sleeping well, but at times have become increasingly irritable and moody (particularly when "coming down" from my mid-day dose before taking my early evening dose). I would not say it is necessarily addictive, but I am reluctant to stop taking the pills because they have been so helpful in helping to suppress my appetite. I would urge caution to anyone with mood disorders when beginning this drug and to consult with a doctor first.

column2: dyme-p, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this has worked wonders for me. my doctor chose to go with the 25 mg 3 times a day. i started taking the pills 07/11/2008 at 193 lbs and wearing a size 16, i was still carrying weight from my beautiful daughter who is now age 4. and today 08/04/2008, i have lost a lot of weight, i am now back into my size 10 calvin klein jeans that i wore when i was age 25 and i am now age 41. the 3 pills a day before eating work great for me. they reduce the hunger that turns into binging for me. i have lost so much weight and without a lot of exercise, although i do plan to incoroporate exercise into the plan to lose additional weight. my doctor simply told me to eat a very large breakfast, of cereal, eggs, english muffin, orange juice and fruit. then make sure when i do eat later on, the meal always consists of lots and lots of salad and water. so simple, but it works. YEA ME :)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking the extended tablets 75mg once daily.  I have lost 15 pounds but been at astand still bsince that.  Is 25mg better theb once daily 75mg?

column2: lett, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: this medication did not work for  me

column2: cpdbldog, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had very little problems with this drug.  It helped take the nagging hunger pain away and allowed me to eat less.  It did not make me tired, I did notice the slight jitters, but nothing too bad.  I have lost 50 pounds on this plan, but with lots and lots of exercise...I did not lose weight if I didn't exercise.  My doctor put me on a 25mg dose after I lost 30 pounds and I only take 1 pill a day to help me through the mid-day hunger time.  I love it and have only good experiences to report.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug does work for appetite control. I have been using it off and on for months. Lately, I have had trouble sleeping at night (I take it at 9am). I have dry mouth, and have lost my sex drive. But, at least I'm thin! Overall, I would not suggest using it for very long. I did not have these symptoms when I first started the drug.

column2: Marian, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been taking this for 1 month (tomorrow) but have had such a good experience I thought I'd share here. My doctor has me taking 1/2 pill in morning and then 1/2 later in day. I did this the first week but cut it down to just 1/2 pill daily. Appetite suppresant has given me hope and allowed me to completely change the foods eaten to healthy now. I've lost about 16 lbs. Obesity runs in my family and I now have hope for the first time in years. The doctor gave me a list of foods to avoid and I've been able to do that. I don't count calories, just eat VERY healthy. No cakes, pies, cookies, soda, ice cream, mashed potatoes, corn, pasta, pizza (you get the idea). I never thought I could go without some of these daily. I now  eat veggies, organic brown rice, omelettes, salad, yogurt, apple juice, bananas, cereal, etc. Back to the doctor tomorrow and feeling good about it.

column2: ciara, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It worked wonders. I look like a different person. It was great.

column2: kristy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Worked great the first 2 months I lost 28 pounds but am struggling to loose anymore even with diet exercise and the pills, they seem to work in the begining and than after a few months start to not.

column2: Rita, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began this medication 4 months ago. I have lost 35 pounds so far. I take one pill at 9:00am and it seems to last all day. No real side effects.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
